intro: Rhinanthus major var. burnatii, commonly known as the Burnet redtop, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its habitat typically includes grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in many regions.
